title: Update regarding PropCo REIT
story_body:
SUPPLY CHAIN CONSTRAINTS IMPACT COMMERCIAL REAL ESTATE SECTOR; PROPCO REIT OPERATIONS AFFECTED

DALLAS, TX -- January 15, 2024, 14:30 CST -- The commercial real estate sector is experiencing significant operational disruptions due to ongoing supply chain constraints affecting construction materials and building systems components, according to industry reports released Tuesday.

PropCo Real Estate Investment Trust (NYSE: PROP), a Dallas-based commercial property owner and operator, confirmed that its development and renovation projects are subject to the same industry-wide material availability issues currently affecting real estate investment trusts nationwide.

The National Association of Real Estate Investment Trusts reported that delivery timelines for critical building materials have extended by an average of 12 to 18 weeks compared to historical norms. Steel framing components, HVAC systems, electrical equipment, and elevator assemblies are among the categories experiencing the most severe availability constraints.

"The commercial real estate sector is navigating a challenging supply environment," stated PropCo Real Estate Investment Trust in a regulatory filing submitted at 13:45 CST. "Material procurement timelines have been extended across multiple product categories, consistent with conditions reported throughout the REIT industry."

Industry data indicates that approximately 67 percent of commercial real estate projects initiated in the fourth quarter of 2023 have experienced schedule adjustments due to material delivery delays. The constraints affect both new construction and major renovation activities across office, retail, and industrial property classifications.

PropCo Real Estate Investment Trust operates a portfolio of 47 commercial properties totaling approximately 8.2 million square feet across six states. The company has four active development projects and eleven renovation initiatives currently in progress.

The supply chain disruptions stem from multiple factors affecting the construction materials industry, including manufacturing capacity limitations, transportation network congestion, and labor availability at production facilities. Industry analysts project that normalized material delivery schedules may not resume until the third or fourth quarter of 2024.

The Real Estate Roundtable, an industry policy organization, indicated that commercial property owners are implementing alternative procurement strategies and adjusting project schedules to accommodate extended material lead times.

PropCo Real Estate Investment Trust shares closed at $34.72 on January 12, 2024, the last trading day prior to this announcement.
